Source: AMC (amc.org.au/pathways/fees-and-charges Feb 2026): CAT MCQ=AUD$2,920 (reduced from $3,124 effective 8 Jan 2024); Clinical Exam in-person=AUD$3,000 (reduced from $3,991 effective 1 Jul 2025; online option AUD$3,400); Medical Board of Australia (medicalboard.gov.au/Registration/Fees effective 1 Aug 2025): provisional registration IMG application=AUD$742 annual registration fee=AUD$521; Dept of Home Affairs (immi.homeaffairs.gov.au effective 1 Jul 2025): Subclass 482 (medium-term stream)=AUD$3,210 (up from $3,115) Subclass 189=AUD$4,910 (up from $4,765); OET (occupationalenglishtest.org): AUD$587; IELTS India (ielts.org): ~INR17,000; OSHC (Allianz/Medibank/Bupa OSHC comparison Feb 2026): single basic ~AUD$4,800 standard ~AUD$5,500 premium ~AUD$6,500/yr; AMC Skills Assessment for migration: ~AUD$500; AMC coaching (Academically.com.au ACE-theExam.com.au SwagAcademy PrepMatch various Indian providers): INR50k-150k; Indian PCC (passportindia.gov.in): INR500 official + processing ~INR3k-5k total; Panel physician medical exam (Delhi/Mumbai/Chennai/Kolkata): INR10k-15k; Flights (Skyscanner/Google Flights Feb 2026 Delhi/Mumbai to Sydney/Melbourne economy return): INR50k-90k
Notes: COMPONENT COLUMN VALUES = typical/single-attempt scenario at AUD/INR 64.00 (Feb 2026 mid-market rate from Wise/XE). MIN/TYPICAL/MAX totals reflect different scenarios as follows. --- MIN SCENARIO (INR 11,27,000): 1× AMC CAT MCQ (186880) + 1× AMC Clinical in-person (192000) + IELTS not OET (17000) + AHPRA provisional IMG application (47488) + AHPRA annual registration (33344) + Skills assessment (32000) + Subclass 482 visa (205440) + NO PR visa (0) + Basic OSHC single AUD4800 (307200) + Budget travel 1 trip (50000) + Budget accommodation (35000) + No coaching (0) + PCC (3000) + Medical exam (10000) + Misc (8000) = INR 11,27,352 ≈ 11,27,000. --- TYPICAL SCENARIO (INR 14,00,000): 1× CAT MCQ (186880) + 1.5× avg Clinical attempts (288000) + OET (37568) + AHPRA application (47488) + AHPRA annual (33344) + Skills assessment (32000) + Visa 482 (205440) + NO PR (0) + Standard OSHC AUD5500 (352000) + Travel 1 trip (70000) + Standard accommodation (50000) + Mid coaching (65000) + PCC (5000) + Medical (12000) + Misc (15000) = INR 13,99,720 ≈ 14,00,000. --- MAX SCENARIO (INR 23,54,000): 2× CAT MCQ (373760) + 2× Clinical (384000) + OET (37568) + AHPRA application (47488) + AHPRA annual (33344) + Skills assessment (32000) + Visa 482 (205440) + Visa 189/190 PR (314240) + Premium OSHC AUD6500 (416000) + Travel 2 trips (180000) + Premium accommodation 2 trips (140000) + Full coaching (150000) + PCC (5000) + Medical (15000) + Misc (20000) = INR 23,53,840 ≈ 23,54,000. --- KEY NOTES: (1) AMC Clinical Exam fee was SIGNIFICANTLY REDUCED from AUD$3,991 to AUD$3,000 (in-person) effective 1 July 2025 — this is a major cost saving for migrating doctors. Online exam option is AUD$3,400. (2) Subclass 482 visa fee increased from AUD$2,645 to AUD$3,115 then to AUD$3,210 (1 July 2025 indexation). (3) AHPRA registration: application fee for provisional IMG is AUD$742; annual registration fee (separate) is AUD$521 for provisional. Total first-year AHPRA cost = AUD$1,263. (4) OSHC or equivalent private health insurance is MANDATORY for 482 visa holders — not optional. (5) AMC Clinical Exam held at AMC National Examination Centre in Melbourne — travel to Melbourne mandatory. (6) Skills assessment by AMC required for 482 visa in ANZSCO 2531xx medical practitioner occupations. (7) AMC Clinical pass rate historically ~50% — most candidates benefit from structured coaching. (8) Subclass 482 medium-term stream applies to medical practitioners; allows pathway to PR via Subclass 186 (employer-sponsored) after 2 years. (9) Subclass 189/190 PR fees also increased from AUD$4,640 to AUD$4,910 (July 2025).
